comments.body:
This seems like it can be simplified with the description from MS's docs https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/powershellget/install-module?view=powershell-6

> Allows you to install a different version of a module that already exists on your computer.

It's a mistake in the documentation of PowerShell (I'll update that there). Allowing multi-version of modules it's not the same as allowing to get precedence of the command incoming from the newly installed module.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +51,55 @@  allow_clobber:
    description:
      - If C(yes) allows install modules that contains commands those have the same names as commands that already exists.
    type: bool
    default: no

comments.body: Wouldn't you still need `state: latest` to upgrade the package or does `skip_publisher_check` always exclude publisher packagers when searching?
`skip_publisher_check` is not used under searching but it's only used to allow install an unsigned version of the module when the signed one is installed.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +110,114 @@    state: latest

- name: Install newer version of built-in Windows module
  win_psmodule:
    name: Pester
